New Records: It was West Indies' joint-largest win over England in T20s and England's largest defeat in the format.
Key Match Events: Jason Holder took 4 for 7 as England was bowled out for 103 in 19.4 overs.
Brandon King scored an unbeaten 52, contributing to the West Indies' nine-wicket win.
Sheldon Cottrell took 2 wickets for 30 runs.
Chris Jordan scored 28 and Adil Rashid scored 22 for England.
West Indies chased down the target with 104/1 in 17.1 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies skipper Kieron Pollard praised the team's performance and highlighted the contributions of Sheldon Cottrell and Jason Holder.
Pollard also commended Brandon King's batting performance.
England captain Eoin Morgan acknowledged the team's poor start and emphasized the need for a fresh game plan.
Jason Holder expressed satisfaction with the team's bounce back after a tough series against Ireland.
